Headline
December’s Cold Moon, the final supermoon of 2025, dazzled stargazers across the UK.
Stunning images of December’s Cold Moon captured worldwide, marking the year’s last full moon.
Farmers are earning income while restoring native forests through a blockchain‑powered app.
Polarisation is weakening trust in institutions as peacebuilding meets digital democracy.
A missile strike on Dnipro has killed four people amid the ongoing Russo‑Ukrainian war.
Sudanese Rapid Support Forces have seized Babanusa, intensifying the civil war.
A strong earthquake struck northern Japan as Australia announced new social media restrictions.
President Trump pledged aid for farmers facing global supply disruptions.
Major trials show GLP‑1 drugs fail to slow Alzheimer’s disease progression.
Scientists suggest a volcanic eruption may have helped spread the Black Plague in Europe.
UK inflation eased slightly in November, offering households modest relief.
Rail strikes continue across Britain, disrupting travel during the busy holiday season.
Climate activists staged protests in London, demanding urgent action on emissions.
Record rainfall has caused flooding in northern England, prompting evacuations.
Global oil prices rose after OPEC announced production cuts.
New AI regulations were unveiled in Brussels, aiming to balance innovation and safety.
England’s cricket team celebrated a decisive win in the Ashes series.
Health officials warned of rising flu cases as winter pressures mount on the NHS.
UK housing market slowed further, with prices dipping in several regions.
Space agency ESA announced plans for a new lunar mission in 2026.
